summary: The Broadband Competition and Efficient Deployment Act aims to streamline the deployment of telecommunications infrastructure. It exempts projects for the collocation of these facilities from certain environmental and historical preservation reviews under the National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA) and the National Historic Preservation Act (NHPA). The bill defines key terms like 'covered project,' 'eligible support infrastructure,' and 'telecommunications service facility,' primarily focusing on projects requiring Federal Communications Commission (FCC) approval.
